subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology
subSections.text:
As [[tea]] may have originated from [[Sichuan]], where the native {{w|Yi people}} speak {{w|Loloish languages}}, {{zh-ref|Sagart (1999)}} suggests that the Old Chinese item was possibly originally borrowed from {{bor|zh|tbq-lol-pro|*la¹||tea}}, from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-la||leaf; tea}}. {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} traces its ultimate origin to {{cog|aav-pro|*sla||leaf}} (compare {{cog|mkh-pro|*slaʔ}}).

Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Qiu (1988)}} suggests that it might be a semantic extension of {{och-l|荼|bitter plant|id=3}}.
